availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Watkins (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hezekiah B. Watkins and Diana F. Wade Watkins. Farm laborer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Farmer in Trigg County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 85.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 375A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Trigg County, KY, June 1863, p. 50.
William Henry Perrin, Counties of Christian and Trigg: Historical and Biographical (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey Publishing Co., 1884), 269.
"John R. Watkins (1829-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial 50227162, accessed April 18, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50227162.
